overview:
Gary Zegiestowsky is the Chief Executive Officer of Informatics Corporation of America (ICA). In late 2005, Mr. Zegiestowsky co-founded ICA with Vanderbilt Medical Center to take technology developed at Vanderbilt to the broader health care market. ICAâ€™s solution offers an unmatched approach to interoperability by harnessing the full value of core systems and building on them with decision-making tools at the point of care. With this solution, ICAâ€™s mission is to drive quality outcomes and clinical effectiveness across an enterprise or a community. Prior to founding ICA, Mr. Zegiestowsky served as COO of a $500 million division of Cendant Corporation serving 6,500 clients and 40 million customers. He began his career with General Electric and also served as a director of the Strategy Consulting Practice with Andersen. Mr. Zegiestowsky has been a recent speaker at several HIMSS events including Texas and New Jersey.

A magna cum laude graduate of West Virginia University, Mr. Zegiestowsky holds a BS in Chemical Engineering and an MBA from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.
